snippet: Already ailing, AM radio now is plagued by a new threat: rising interference from smartphones and consumer electronics that reduce many stations to little more than static.
abstract: AM radio, having already suffered long decline in popularity, is now being threatened by interference from smartphones and consumer electronics that have reduced many stations to little more than static; Ajit Pai, lone Republican on Federal Communications Commission, has undertaken quixotic quest to save AM, noting its cultural importance and its usefulness during emergencies in rural areas.
lead_paragraph: Already ailing, AM radio now is plagued by a new threat: rising interference from smartphones and consumer electronics that reduce many stations to little more than static.

headline.main: A Quest to Save AM Before It’s Lost in the Static
headline.print_headline: A Quest to Save AM Before It’s Lost in the Static
